transportAdvice: Seattle has a light rail system, extensive bus network, and streetcar lines that connect major neighborhoods and tourist areas, making public transit a practical option for most visitors. The downtown core and waterfront are walkable, though the city's hilly terrain can be challenging on foot, and taxis and rideshare vehicles are widely available.

weather.description: January is cool, grey, and frequently rainy, with occasional frost but rarely snow at sea level.
February remains damp and overcast, though daylight hours begin to noticeably increase.
March brings mild temperatures but continued frequent rain and cloudy skies.
April sees a gradual brightening with occasional sunny spells mixed with showers and blooming cherry trees.
May is one of the most pleasant months, with warming temperatures and increasingly dry, sunny days.
June marks the beginning of Seattle's dry season, with long daylight hours and comfortably warm weather.
July is warm and reliably sunny, making it one of the best months to visit with very little rainfall.
August is Seattle's warmest and driest month, ideal for outdoor activities and exploring the waterfront.
September remains warm and largely dry, often considered the most reliably pleasant month of the year.
October brings cooling temperatures and the return of rain, with beautiful autumn foliage across the city.
November is notably wet and grey, with short days and frequent rain marking the return of the Pacific Northwest winter.
December is cold, rainy, and overcast, though the city's festive holiday atmosphere adds seasonal charm.
